CatDescriptText: Mr. Edward Clark, 7215 Lemington Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 25, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that business and employment are as good as the Eisenhower administration declares that it is?" answer reads: "No, I can't say so. Because they say the amount of employment has picked up, and the production of automobiles has increased, does not change my opinion.  Everything else is the same."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Edward Clark wearing hat with braided band and moustache, standing on sidewalk in front of 82 Lincoln trolley
